title: CAN'T DELETE SOME RECURRING EVENTS IN BUILT IN CALENDAR - TB 102.9.1

How can I delete these, which I suspect come from another calendar I am not using? I can’t find any basic sync command in SETTINGS to turn them off. I am a very basic user ie personal emails, web browsing and documents, and don’t understand computer jargon.

I tried using CONVERT TO but that just seems to multiply more events which are not deletable!

title: [Help] Problems receiving emails - Thunderbird
content:
Hello,

We have a several computers, all on the same network and use the same internet connection, but a very strange situation happens in one of the PCs.

Always Thunderbird is running, there is no problem and all the emails I receive are marked as "unread" (stay bold and so far everything is correct). Now always Thunderbird is NOT running, all the emails they send me during that time, the next time that run/open Thunderbird and load the emails will appear as "read" (No bold). Why?

I already thought it could be because I had set up the phone and made some interference, but we did the same experience with another email and PC worked correctly.

I already changed Antivirus, checked if the PC had viruses. I created a rule whenever I received a new email would go to another folder, and other ideas, but without success.

Can anyone help me?

title: Email Stalker
content:
It appears that someone else is checking my emails before I do. I have been logged in twice this week to visabily see the emails that I see that are new become, "read", as I am looking at them.

Considering it happened yesterday before I received an email informing me that my storage unit was robbed it happened. Also, ALL of my emails are gone from the past 2 years. Two of them were threats. When I went to print it out..The emails had been replaced with a completely different email and it was marked as read. I actually never read the two. I saw the threats from the subject and did not open them.

What is going on?

title: Can't move any message from inbox to ONE of my other folders
content:
Hello,

I'm using Tbird 102.9.0 on Linux Mint v20. After a few days of running I cannot move messages from the inbox to any other folder. Closing Tbird and re-opening does not work. I tried RMB-Move To, file menu Message-Move To, and drag-n-drop, none of those works.

After a few tries to move messages from the inbox to other folders fails, I can no longer delete messages from the inbox, and the message view pane does not update when I click on a different message in the inbox. If I close Tbird and re-open, these functions work again.

Note, I updated the subject after I discovered it seems to be just one folder that I cannot move new message into. Also, using a menu "Move To" function to try to move messages into this folder locks up my inbox. Drag-n-drop doesn't work either, but it doesn't lock-up my inbox.

TIA, -Brad
creator: bradjohnson2

title: Fiber optic internet and thunderbird/how do I do it
content: I currently have Spectrum internet and now a new fiber optic company is installing their product in my small rural town. I would love to have them and no longer have to deal with Spectrum's outages, etc. However, they do not offer an email service and suggest that I use gmail or yahoo or other web based service. I do not like either of those and have used Thunderbird for many years. Can anyone Than tell me if it is possible to continue using Thunderbird and how will I do it? Thanks for any help. I just want to add that I am 75 years old and really don't do the technical stuff very well. I am willing to try though.Thanks, Jennifer

title: Reply button in email preview pane  does not act like the Reply option in right-click context menu
content:
Hi I have multiple email accounts setup in Thunderbird. My problem is that when I receive an email addressed to more than one of my accounts, if I reply using the reply button in the email preview pane, it sometimes using a different From account in the reply than the one I am replying from BUT does not happen if I use the Reply in the right-click context menu or the Message->Reply option. So I setup identities on each account and selected the "reply from this identity" and typed in the that profile email address to try and fix it. The problem still occurs when using the button in the preview pane BUT does not happen if I use the Reply in the right-click context menu or the Message->Reply option. Why is that and how can it be fixed? Can I remove the reply option in the preview pane somehow? I think this problem might be new as I have not seen this behaviour before and have always used . It appears that it chooses the first of my accounts listed in the recipient list of the email to place in the From field. Again this does not occur on any other Reply option I tried.

Thanks in advance for any help with this
creator: denis.desjardins1

title: Why do "From" and "Correspondents" show the same info - neither is the true "reply" address
content:
102.9.1 (32-bit)

I get emails with From/Correspondents columns showing i.e. checklistnova.co|Hoses".

Yet, when I select Message/Filter Rules is says "From" is "anyplace@kabobprior.com". Why do neither the "From" nor "Correspondents" columns show the true sender of the message as "Filter Rules" shows?

It is a waste to have two columns displaying the same "fake" info when one could show the true sender.

The issue is that the account sender is randomly generated and can quickly be identified as spam while the displayed data less so.
creator: denkelly

title: CSS page breaks in emails no longer printing
content:
Previously if we crafted an HTML email we could use the @media print CSS section to force a page break before or after an element. With Thunderbird 102.9.0 the CSS for forcing a page break is being ignored in HTML emails.

If I save the message source as an HTML file and open it in Firefox the print preview shows the correct page breaks, but in Thunderbird the content all runs together.

title: SMTP Service Error with TB 102.9 on Mac OS 10.15
content: After updating from TB 102.7.0 to TB 102.9.0 on my Mac OS 10.15.7, I cannot send mail on one of my mail accounts and getting the following message: "Sending of the message failed. The message could not be sent because the connection to Outgoing server (SMTP) smtphm.sympatico.ca was lost in the middle of the transaction." With the previous versions of TB, I did not have any issue with this problem. The settings of this SMTP server is: Port 587, Connection Security SSL/TLS, Authentication method = Normal password. These settings worked perfectly in the previous version of TB! Any suggestions? Thanks.

title: Bitdefender found trojans in my Thunderbird Profiles
content:
Thunderbird has been running slow and locking up frequently. I just completed a complete Bitdefender scan of my computer. It is reporting that there are Trojans and showing them in my TB profiles.

If I tell Bitdefender to clear it out, I get a message that says to manually delete the attachments from the email client but it doesn't tell me where they are.

How do I get rid of the trojans without loosing years worth of email messages?

From the log, I have a lot that look like this: C:\Users\Linda Dickinson\AppData\Roaming\Thunderbird\Profiles\vus1oehd.Linda-3\Mail\Local Folders\Archive.sbd\Darol.sbd\Darol-2021=>message 363719: [Date: 26 Mar 2021 01:40:23 -0700] [From: CHEN XIAOYU>info@chinaporousfilters.com] [Subject: Re:: PROFORMA INVOICE AND BANK DETAILS]=>[Subject: Re:: PROFORMA INVOICE AND BANK DETAILS][Date: 26 Mar 2021 01:40:23 -0700]=>INVOICE 25667833822..rar=>INVOICE 25667833822..exe Trojan.GenericKD.45974407

By a lot, I mean over 5K. I know I could run a search in thunderbird for that Subject line and delete them. But there are many many different subjects. The PROFORMA INVOICE one seems to be the vast majority of them though.
creator: kirk2892

creator: chris541

title: IMAP server, dragging a message from its inbox to a local folder does not delete from the server
content:
Greetings, folks!

I am fairly new to using an IMAP connection between Thunderbird and the host mail server, HostMonster. There's behavior that I could use your help understanding. First, I can send and receive mail just fine. Basic configuration works. The issue is this:

When incoming messages appear in Thunderbird's inbox for the IMAP account, I drag (move) them to an appropriate local folder for archiving. That works fine. The message disappears from the account's inbox and now is in that local folder. If, however, I log in to the hosting company's web email interface (roundcube), and look at the IMAP inbox, the moved messages are still there, but grayed out. They are marked as deleted, but still (in some nebulous state) in the inbox. I can manually select then delete the grayed-out messages, and they go away permanently.

If, on the other hand, I select a message in Thunderbird's inbox and delete it, the message disappears from both Thunderbird's IMAP inbox and the web email interface (roundcube) inbox. That's as expected.

SO, the question is whether there is a Thunderbird configuration setting that I've missed, which will actually delete the messages from the server's inbox?

Thanks very much for your help.
creator: trachier

title: Thunderbird suddenly stopped working and will no longer load successfully
content:
Thursday both Thunderbird and Fire fox suddenly stopped working with a message that they were no responding. I closed the windows and tried to bring them back in. The response was

Thunderbird is already running, but is not responding. The old Thunderbird process must be closed to open a new window. I cancelled and looked at the task manager which indicated that thunderbird was not there. After another try I did a conputer restart and finally a shutdown , unplug and restart with the same result.

I I refreshed thunderbird, no luck. I deleted and reinstalled Thunderbird, still no go. ( I was doing the same thing with Firefox. I had to go out of town for 2 days and Firefox has healed itself but thunderbird still doesn't work. HELP!

I'll be looking for emails on my phone, I don't want to use a different email on my desktop.
creator: geniec
